node.statement: Local vertex model classification: At each vertex v of K where 4 Lagrangian faces meet, the tangent cone TC_v(K) consists of 4 Lagrangian half-planes in (R^4, omega) forming a topological disk. The link of v in S^3 is a simple closed curve composed of 4 great circle arcs. The configuration is classified into: Type A (generic) where the 4 half-planes lie in 4 distinct Lagrangian planes with non-consecutive pairs transverse, or Type B (crossing) where opposite half-planes are coplanar, forming two transverse Lagrangian planes. Both types are characterized by the intersection pattern in the Lagrangian Grassmannian LG(2,4) = U(2)/O(2). The Sp(4,R)-equivalence class is determined by finitely many continuous parameters (Kahler angles).
